feed.title: SAP Community - Cloud Connector
feed.subtitle: Cloud Connector Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Error in SAP Mobile Services and Cloud Connector without main propagation
entry.content:
Hi community,

I'm facing a persistent issue with SAP Mobile Services and SAP Cloud Connector.

üìå Scenario:

  • I have a mobile application configured in SAP Mobile Services.

  • The destination points to an on-premise system via Cloud Connector.

  • Destination configuration:

    • Type: Cloud Connector

    • Authentication: Basic Authentication

    • User propagation: Disabled

  • In the mobile app:

    • Security is configured as OAuth (via XSUAA)

‚ùó Problem:

Even though authentication is set to Basic and principal propagation is disabled, Cloud Connector keeps logging the following warning repeatedly:

The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.

This happens every time the mobile app calls the destination.

‚ùì Question:

How can I prevent SAP Mobile Services from sending the SSO (Bearer) token when using a destination with Basic Authentication?
Is there any way to force SAP Mobile Services not to send the OAuth token, even if the app is secured with OAuth?

Any help or experience from someone who has solved this in a similar scenario would be greatly appreciated.

Destination: 

Cloud connector:

 

Logs:

2025-06-11 08:47:03,615 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x79d8e706#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:03,944 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0xf425f394#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:04,459 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0xc45ba802#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:10,583 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x043ba202#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:13,150 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x836b866c#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:14,072 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x62a66969#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:21,714 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x09a22876#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:21,933 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x26fd940c#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|
2025-06-11 08:47:23,808 -0500#WARN#com.sap.core.connectivity.protocol.http.handlers.HttpNoAuthenticationHandler#tunnel-client-804-7#0x58380bba#The Cloud Connector has not been configured for principal propagation. Please configure it or discontinue sending the SSO token in the request.|

 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Create local users in SAP Cloud Connector without using LDAP
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

i was wondering if it is possible to create users for Monitoring etc. in Cloud Connector without using an LDAP.

There is a users.xml file in the config folder of the SCC installation path. But I didnt figure out how to add users here. Or is there an other way?

Greetings

Rouven

entry.title: Integration|Connectivity|Destinations|supplier collaboration on provisional specifications in EPD
entry.content:
Hi team,

We are trying to use the supplier collaboration functionality on provisional specifications in SAP EPD.

Trying to integrate the backend S4Hana system to EPD, so as to load the value sets to EPD, and then to create property groups and specifications. However, we are still unable to proceed with this integrations due to some connectivity/destination errors.

We have activated all the relevant API's in the backed, Cloud connector setup is active with backend system connected, created PLM_CORE destination pointing towards the cloud conenctor with backend system URL.

Ideally when we try to load data from EPD, it should connect to BTP cloud connector, then to the backend system and get data through the activated API's. But we are getting an error "Core system cant be reached, set up destination in th ecockpit". We have configured PLM_CORE already and the connection check was successfull as well.

Any idea what could be missing here?

Thanks   in advance for your help.

entry.title: 403 Forbidden Error on API-Proxy (BTP Integration Suite) to OnPremise-Webservice
entry.content:
Hello All,

I can‚Äôt find a solution to my problem.
My goal is to make a Webervice from an OnPremise-System available over BTP but i always get the generic HTTP error 403 Forbidden.

Basically, I have almost the same requirement as described here: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/create-api-provider-in-sap-integration-suite-for-sap-s-4hana/bc-p/14052913#M180019
A CloudConnector is already set up for the OnPremise-System and seems to be working correctly.

I‚Äôm using a Trial-BTP account.
I created an API Provider pointing to the OnPremise system, and built an API Proxy based on that provider.
In the API Provider, I also configured the Catalog Service to expose available OData services.

What works:

  • API proxies using normal URLs work fine.

  • The Cloud Connector can successfully connect to the OnPremise system.

  • The tunnel from Cloud Connector to BTP is working:

  • The configured Catalog Service in BTP Integration Suite also responds correctly:


I can see that requests from BTP do reach the OnPremise system.

Also the can "Discover" the existing ODATA-Webservices of the OnPremise when i create a new API-Proxy. Again a working request from BTP to OnPremise.

That‚Äôs why I believe the problem is somewhere in the request to the Trial-BTP itself or in the Trial-BTP configuration.

What I‚Äôve tried:

  • I checked roles/role collections. I created a role collection with all available roles to ensure I have all necessary permissions.

  • I tested different backend services and protocols. I now test directly via the Catalog Service, since I know that one can be reached.

  • I tried the API Debugger, but the information shown doesn‚Äôt help me understand the issue.

Additional info:

  • I send test requests via Postman, using Basic Auth with my OnPremise login credentials.

  • I‚Äôm not using principal propagation on the OnPremise side or in the CloudConnector.

My Questions:

  • Does anyone see why I‚Äôm still getting a 403 Forbidden error?

  • Could this be caused by a limitation in the Trial-BTP that I‚Äôm not aware of?

  • Or maybe it‚Äôs something completely different?

I hope someone can help me out with this. Let me know if you need any other infos or screenshots.
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Install Cloud Connector together with SAP private Cloud (Rise)
entry.content:
We are currently getting SAP private cloud (Rise).
We need the SAP Cloud Connector for the connection to BTP and on-premises.
Now I have heard that you get this from SAP if you have Rise, i.e. the CC then runs at SAP and does not have to be installed on-premises on your own computer.

1. is that true?
2. what do I have to do for SAP to make it available?
3. how do you connect to it, i.e. where do you get the data from?

Thanks

entry.title: SAP CAP : 502 "Error during request to remote service: read ECONNRESET"
entry.content:
Hi,

I am developing SAP CAP application, node.js, trying to connect to external S4 onPrem service which is accessed via the cloud connector.

I am trying to reach S4 OData service from CAP Application locally in Business Application Studio via SAP Cloud Connector.

To connect to the destination and other services we are using the ‚Äúcds bind -2‚Äù command, which created the .cdsrc-private.json file.

I am able to connect to the different BTP instances like the destination, authorization and connectivity instances, when i run the app using 

cds watch --profile hybrid

But when i'm trying to access any of the entities within the S4 OData service facing the following error,

{"error":{"code":"502","message":"Error during request to remote service: read ECONNRESET"}}

Has anyone faced this issue, please suggest an appropriate solution for this.

Also when the applicaiton is deployed to BTP,  the S4 odata services are accessiable via destination and the application is working as expected,

i want run the application locally for development phase, hence need your help,

Regards,

Aakash

entry.title: Establishing Inbound Connection from AWS to HANA Cloud via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
We are working on establishing an inbound connection to our SAP HANA Cloud database from an application hosted on an AWS instance. Our goal is to securely connect our application to the HANA DB.

We have already established a successful connection using AWS PrivateLink. However, for specific architectural reasons, we now need to implement this connection using the SAP Cloud Connector.

Here‚Äôs what we have accomplished so far:

  1. Cloud Connector Installation: We have successfully installed the SAP Cloud Connector on a dedicated instance.
  2. SAP HANA Client Installation: The SAP HANA Client has been installed on the application server within AWS.
  3. Subaccount Connection: We have connected our BTP subaccount, which contains our SAP HANA Cloud instance, to the Cloud Connector, and it shows as "Connected."
  4. Cloud to On-Premise Mapping: We have configured a "Cloud to On-Premises" mapping in the Cloud Connector.
    • Backend Type: SAP HANA
    • Virtual Host & Port: We have defined a virtual host and port.
    • Internal Host & Port: We have mapped this to the internal hostname and port of our HANA Cloud database.

Despite these steps, we are facing challenges in getting the application on AWS to communicate with the HANA Database through this Cloud Connector setup.

Our question is:

What are the specific next steps or configurations required on the AWS side and within the BTP subaccount to make the HANA Cloud database accessible from our AWS-hosted application via the virtual host and port we defined in the Cloud Connector?

We have reviewed the standard documentation, but we are looking for insights from anyone who has successfully implemented a similar architecture. Any guidance, best practices, or troubleshooting tips would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: SAP API PROXY principal propagation error 403
entry.content:
Greetings SAP community,

I have been trying to expose an ODATA service on our on-premsis ECC system through Integration Suite's API Proxy.

I configured all the nesscary steps between BTP and SCC, SCC and the back-end system so that the identity is forwarded to SCC and then to the back-end system by X.509.

I have confirmed that Principal Propagation works as i use it in a Destination Configuration with SAP Graph and it forwards the identity correctly, requests are executed sucessfully.

However when i try to send a request through API Proxy, i recieve an error 403. API Management isnt exactly clear on how the request should be sent to the proxy, whether it should contain a specific header or a token. I have tried to send the JWT recieved from the OAUTH server for an Integration Flow client in the Authorization Header, still getting the same 403 error.

The API provider created for the proxy uses Authentication type "Principal Propagation".

I would appreciate help in this matter.

entry.title: What does <Connectivity Service Unavailable> mean when connecting to a Private Cloud system?
entry.content:
We are currently encountering the error message '<Connectivity/ServiceUnavailable>: No se ha podido obtener el contenido debido a un error interno' when trying to connect our SAP BTP environment to an SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud system. Our setup includes properly configured destinations, as shown in the attached screenshots. However, the content channel creation fails, and we receive the mentioned connectivity error.

We speculate that this might be related to an internal SAP connectivity issue, or perhaps there is something specific we may have overlooked in our configuration.

Could anyone provide guidance on:

  • What specifically triggers the '' error?

  • Common configuration oversights that could lead to this issue?

  • Any steps we could take to verify our connectivity configuration or troubleshoot further?

We appreciate any insights or suggestions!

Thank you!

entry.title: ABAP Platform pipeline in SAP CI/CD Service - release issue
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have a problem with my ABAP Platform pipeline, using SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery Service in BTP. The issue is with the Release part.

I have a Cloud Connector and destination (using Principal Propagation) ready. The deployment from SAP BAS works as expected. All necessary OData Services are active and whitelisted. However, there's 401 error when the pipeline is executed.

[2025-07-29T14:59:03.441Z] Sending GET request to http://XXX:400/sap/opu/odata/UI5/ABAP_REPOSITORY_SRV/
[2025-07-29T14:59:03.677Z] Release stage credentials successfully validated against endpoint
...
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - No deploy dependencies provided. Skipping npm install call. Assuming current docker image already contains the dependencies for performing the deployment.
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - running shell script: /bin/sh #!/bin/sh -e
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] fiori deploy --failfast --yes --username ABAP_USER --password ABAP_PASSWORD --description "Pipeline Test" --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" --url http://XXX:400 --transport GXXXXXXXX --package Z_PACKAGE --name Z_TEST
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Creating archive with UI5 build result.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Archive created.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Starting to deploy.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Deployment has failed.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Change logging level to debug your issue
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST 	(see examples https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/tree/main/packages/deploy-tooling#configuration-with-logging-enabled)
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m builder:custom deploy-to-abap Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.279Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - Command deploy failed with error : Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.331Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - fatal error: errorDetails{"category":"undefined","correlationId":"n/a","error":"running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1","library":"SAP/jenkins-library","message":"step execution failed","result":"failure","stepName":"transportRequestUploadCTS","time":"2025-07-29T14:59:39.890292594Z"}
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.332Z] fatal transportRequestUploadCTS - step execution failed - running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1

 I use Job Editor configuration mode. No code is used for the pipeline. 

Upload credentials is Basic Auth. using my Username and Password. These are no issues with it, as I've tested successfully.

I also use Cloud Connector, with Location ID specified on the destination level.

I have a couple of doubts:

- I see the --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" is used. Is there any special ui5-deploy content I have to add? I use destination there.

- Is ABAP Platform Endpoint the URL that I can find on my Destination level?

- Location ID - documentation says it should be found on the Cloud Connector level in BTP Cockpit, but it's false. There's Location ID, but only on the Destination level.

Any idea what could be the issue?

BR,

Adrian

‚ÄîkadambalaSaikiran

entry.title: JDBC (Microsoft SQL) Connectivity issue In SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to establish a connection to an on prem Microsoft SQL server via JDBC adapter in SAP CPI. I'm getting an error
org.springframework.jdbc.CannotGetJdbcConnectionException: Failed to obtain JDBC Connection; nested exception is com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1106 has failed. Error: "The driver received an unexpected pre-login response. Verify the connection properties and check that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. This driver can be used only with SQL Server 2005 or later.". ClientConnectionId:1fe33d15-3b89-41fa-b211-672cb643ff12, cause: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1106 has failed. Error: "The driver received an unexpected pre-login response. Verify the connection properties and check that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. This driver can be used only with SQL Server 2005 or later.". ClientConnectionId:1fe33d15-3b89-41fa-b211-672cb643ff12
The driver I've installed in CPI is V8.4.1

My JDBC configuration is 

Is this the correct driver version I'm using, and in the error, it mentions port as 1106, I've not maintained that port, why is it coming in the error? How do I resolve this error?

Please help.

Thanks in advance!
Shreyas.

entry.title: Business Application Studio Cannot See BTP Destinations (Platform Issue)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am facing a persistent issue where my Business Application Studio dev space is unable to see a BTP destination I've configured. The destination itself is set up correctly and the connection to my on-premise system is working perfectly, but it does not appear in the Fiori generator.

Environment:

  • BTP Environment: Trial Account

  • Region: US East (VA) - AWS

  • BAS Dev Space Type: SAP Fiori

Summary of the situation:

  1. I have successfully installed and configured the SAP Cloud Connector.

  2. I have created a destination in my BTP subaccount that connects to my on-premise SAP system. This destination has the required properties: HTML5.DynamicDestination = true and WebIDEUsage = odata_gen.

  3. Crucially, when I click the "Check Connection" button for this destination in the BTP Cockpit, the check is successful and returns a "200 OK - Backend is reachable" message. This confirms the entire end-to-end connection is working correctly.

  4. However, when I go into a Business Application Studio dev space and use the SAP Fiori generator, this destination does not appear in the "System" dropdown list.

  5. I have tried restarting the dev space, which did not solve the issue. I then deleted the dev space and created a brand new "SAP Fiori" dev space, and the destination is still not visible.

  6. When I run the diagnostic command npx fiori-tools destination in the terminal of the new dev space, I receive a DNS error:

    npm ERR! code ENOTFOUND
npm ERR! syscall getaddrinfo
npm ERR! errno ENOTFOUND
npm ERR! request to https://.../_.../destinations failed, reason: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND ...

This ENOTFOUND error in a brand new dev space, combined with the successful connection check in the cockpit, strongly suggests a platform-level DNS or networking issue within the BAS environment for my trial account.

Could you please advise if this is a known issue or what the next steps should be? I believe I have exhausted all possible configuration and troubleshooting steps.

Thank you for your help.

entry.content:

entry.title: Best Practices for Enforcing API Governance for Applications Co-located with S/4HANA in Same Cloud I
entry.content:
I have an architectural question regarding API governance and security:

Current Scenario:

  • S/4HANA On-Premise system deployed in AWS cloud infrastructure
  • External applications accessing S/4HANA On-Premise OData/APIs are properly governed through:
    • SAP Cloud Connector (for BTP applications)
    • API Management (for external platform applications)

Challenge: Applications deployed in the same AWS infrastructure as S/4HANA On-Premise can potentially access the OData services/APIs directly, bypassing any API governance layer. This creates a security and governance gap. 

 Questions:

  1. What are the recommended approaches to ensure all API access to S/4HANA On-Premise is properly governed, even for co-located applications?
  2. Are there any reference architectures or best practices for implementing API governance within the same cloud infrastructure
  3. How can we enforce the use of API Management or similar governance layer for applications in the same network?

    Any guidance, documentation links, or reference architectures would be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance !


    [Attached simplified architecture diagram showing the scenario]

entry.title: Provision of Sales Cloud V2 APIs via Integration Suite and Cloud Connector for on-prem clients
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

As part of our ongoing platform transformation, we are migrating to Sales Cloud V2 and S/4HANA. Initial testing within our sandbox environment has confirmed successful access to the Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

For productive use, we aim to establish a secure and scalable integration architecture by leveraging SAP Integration Suite in conjunction with the Cloud Connector. This setup is intended to enable on-premise clients to proactively consume Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

The envisioned scenario involves external calls initiated from on-prem systems, with responses returned from the cloud ‚Äî for example, accessing data related to the Business Partner object.

We would like to validate whether this architecture is technically feasible and aligns with best practices for hybrid connectivity and secure API exposure.

entry.title: Principal propagation in sap CPI to ECC
entry.content:
HI Members,

Hope you are doing well.

i have scenario as external system is sending data to SAP CPI from there it should reach to ECC via Cloud connector and do the transaction with same user as external system sent. where external system is using basic authentication and message is reaching to sap CPI but when request is going to ECC it giving error as "no identity configured for the user" . same user existed in sap ecc but its failing even we used the principal propagation setup in ECC and cert mapping in ECC.

 Can you please help me with details to do the principal propagation in SAP CPI to ECC .

Thanks & Regards

Madhu
